article.headline: Boston U. 80, Vermont 70
article.story: BURLINGTON, Vt. (AP) -- Chaz Carr scored 25 points to lead Boston University to an 80-70 victory over Vermont on Sunday and the Terriers took over first place in the America East Conference. The Terriers (19-4, 13-1) shot 54 percent for the game, including 65 percent in the second half when they went 6-for-7 from beyond the 3-point line. Taylor Coppenrath had 24 points and nine rebounds for the Catamounts (16-6, 12-1), who had their school-record winning streak stopped at 13 games. The loss also snapped Vermont's 13-game home winning streak. Consecutive 3-pointers by Jason Grochowalski and Carr gave Boston its largest lead, 71-52, with 6:41 to go. The Catamounts cut the deficit to 74-67 with 2:07 to play on a baseline jumper by Alex Jensen, but they got no closer. Ryan Butt and Grochowalski each had 12 points for Boston. T.J. Sorrentine had 23 points and six assists for the Catamounts.
